decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of cards that allow for a landless combo strategy. The deck aims to quickly mill the opponent by repeatedly sacrificing and returning creatures to the battlefield, triggering abilities such as Prized Amalgam and Creeping Chill for damage and life gain. The deck also utilizes various creatures and spells to manipulate the opponent's hand, disrupt their strategy, and search for specific combo pieces. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds additional flexibility and value to the deck's gameplay.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to establish control over the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Sinister Sabotage, while also generating incremental value through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Chemister's Insight. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, while also generating card advantage with Shark Typhoon and Wilderness Reclamation. By leveraging a mix of disruption, card advantage, and powerful threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.

This deck focuses on playing fast and aggressive creatures to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It includes powerful cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Torbran, Thane of Red Fell, and Goblin Chainwhirler to deal a lot of damage quickly. The deck also includes spells like Lightning Strike, Wild Slash, and Spikefield Hazard to clear the way for its creatures and finish off the opponent. With a low mana curve and plenty of burn spells, this deck aims to win games quickly by overwhelming the opponent with its aggressive creatures and direct damage spells.

This deck focuses on attacking fast and aggressively with low-cost creatures to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It also includes burn spells to finish off the opponent or deal with their creatures. The deck aims to maintain a consistent tempo and pressure the opponent to make quick decisions while utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to pump up the damage. The inclusion of cards like Collective Defiance and Light Up the Stage helps keep the hand full and the board presence strong.

The main concept of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells while also utilizing the powerful mana ramp from Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx. By playing tempo creatures like Gadwick, the Wizened and Thassa, God of the Sea, the deck aims to control the board and outpace the opponent. With the ability to flash in creatures and counter spells using Leyline of Anticipation and Ashiok's Erasure, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own creatures, ultimately winning through combat damage or card advantage with Thassa's Oracle.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game while ramping up mana to cast powerful spells and creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck includes counterspells like Neutralize and Dovin's Veto, as well as cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By using cards like Growth Spiral and Shark Typhoon, the deck aims to establish board presence and eventually win the game through either overwhelming the opponent or casting Approach of the Second Sun for a quick victory.

The deck focuses on generating a wide board of creature tokens and maximizing their value through cards like Anointed Procession and Conclave Tribunal. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with aggressive plays like Legion's Landing, Raise the Alarm, and Saproling Migration, while also providing additional support through powerful planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. The deck also includes cards like Nissa, Voice of Zendikar and Omen of the Sun to generate additional tokens and provide tempo advantage. Overall, the deck emphasizes a fast and consistent token strategy to pressure opponents and secure victories.

The deck focuses on utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn's powerful ability to draw cards and gain card advantage. It includes various multicolored spells to maximize Niv-Mizzet's potential and control the game through removal and disruption. The deck also includes a diverse land base to ensure consistent mana fixing for casting spells of different colors. With a mix of control elements and powerful creatures, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and grind out wins through card advantage and smart decision-making.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Lotus Cobra and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, to cast powerful spells like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Genesis Ultimatum. The control aspect is maintained through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt opponents' plans and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to clear the board if needed. Kenrith, the Returned King provides additional versatility and utility. The deck aims to establish board control early on and overwhelm opponents with its powerful ramp and control elements.

This deck focuses on efficiently ramping up mana using Arboreal Grazer and Lotus Field while utilizing cards like Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Hidden Strings to untap Lotus Field for explosive turns. Baral, Chief of Compliance helps with card filtering and cost reduction, while Fae of Wishes allows access to a sideboard for added flexibility. The deck aims to set up a large amount of mana quickly to cast game-winning spells like Dig Through Time and Mastermind's Acquisition, while also having backup plans in Bala Ged Recovery and Blast Zone for added control.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and the opponent's resources through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It aims to outvalue the opponent with powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon while disrupting their game plan with cards like Extinction Event and Negate. The inclusion of Wilderness Reclamation allows for explosive turns and mana advantage, while the versatile card Thassa's Intervention provides additional control and card selection. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of control elements and powerful finishers.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up green mana with cards like Llanowar Elves and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to play powerful green creatures like Elder Gargaroth and Voracious Hydra. Karn, the Great Creator adds versatility with artifact hate and Nissa, Who Shakes the World provides additional ramp and card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and efficient creature strategy while utilizing Nissa's land untapping ability to generate an advantage in mana production.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures and burn spells. By playing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Ghitu Lavarunner alongside burn spells such as Lightning Strike and Boros Charm, you can quickly chip away at your opponent's life total. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows you to consistently bring back creatures from your graveyard to maintain pressure on your opponent. The deck aims to win the game quickly before your opponent can stabilize.

Utilizing Fires of Invention as a key engine, this control deck aims to control the board with powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Teferi, while using Lukka and Transmogrify to cheat out Agent of Treachery for additional value. The deck also includes various removal spells like Anger of the Gods and Chained to the Rocks to deal with opposing threats. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as the companion to provide additional value and card advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats and card advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and resources through a combination of planeswalkers, removal spells, and fires of invention to cast multiple spells each turn. The deck utilizes Yorion as a companion for additional value and consistency. By leveraging powerful Planeswalkers like Teferi and Chandra, along with versatile removal spells like Supreme Verdict and Anger of the Gods, the deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can secure a win condition. Fires of Invention allows for explosive turns, while Fae of Wishes provides access to a versatile sideboard for additional answers.

This deck focuses on creating a fast-paced, aggressive strategy by using auras to enhance and protect its creatures. By utilizing powerful auras like All That Glitters and Ethereal Armor, along with creatures like Favored Hoplite and Hateful Eidolon, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds resilience and consistency to the deck, allowing for easy access to key cards. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure smooth gameplay and optimal color distribution.
